alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains Foothills; Eastern Culberson County; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL CULBERSON COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM CDT... At 514 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northeast of Plateau, or 17 miles northwest of Kent, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Culberson County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Davis Mountains Foothills; Eastern Culberson County; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
